intro: Brachystelma tumakurense, commonly known as the Kgalagadi starling cactus, is a unique succulent native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its compact, branching structure and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its fleshy stems and leaves. It produces pale blue or white flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators like bees and moths. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
